question: What is the function of the controller in a software-defined network?

choices: multicast replication at the hardware level

question: Refer to the exhibit. R1 learns all routes via OSPF Which command configures a backup static route on R1 to reach the 192.168.20.0/24 network via R3?
Which wireless security protocol relies on Perfect Forward Secrecy?

Refer to the exhibit. Router R1 resides in OSPF Area 0. After updating the R1 configuration to influence the paths that it will use to direct traffic, an engineer verified that each of the four Gigabit interfaces has the same route to 10.10.0.0/16.

    R1#show run
    router ospf 1
    auto-cost referenge -bandwidth 100000
    interface GigabitEthecnet0/0
    bandwidth 10000000
    !
    interface GigabitEthernet0/1
    bandwidth 100000000
    interface GigabitEthernet0/2
    ip ospf cost 100
    !
    interface GigabitEthernet0/3
    ip ospf cost 1000
    end

Which interface will R1 choose to send traffic to reach the route?
Which two spanning-tree states are bypassed on an interface running PortFast? (Choose two.)
Which Layer 2 switch function encapsulates packets for different VLANs so that the packets traverse the same port and maintain traffic separation between the VLANs?

choices: A distributed management plane must be used.
Software upgrades are performed from a central controller
Complexity increases when new device configurations are added
Custom applications are needed to configure network devices

question:
Refer to the exhibit. Packets received by the router from BGP enter via a serial interface at 209.165.201.10.

    EIGRP 10.10.10.0/24[90/1441] via F0/10
    EIGRP 10.10.10.0/24[90/144] via F0/11
    EIGRP 10.10.10.0/24 [90/1441] via F0/12
    OSPF 10.10.10.0/24 [110/20]via F0/13
    OSPF 10.10.10.0/24 [110/30]via F0/14

Each route is present within the routing table. Which interface is used to forward traffic with a destination IP of 10.10.10.24?

Refer to the exhibit. An engineer has started to configure replacement switch SW1.
To verify part of the configuration, the engineer issued the commands as shown and noticed that the entry for PC2 is missing.
Which change must be applied to SW1 so that PC1 and PC2 communicate normally?

choices:
SW1(config)#interface fa0/2
SW1(config-if)#no switchport mode trunk
SW1(config-if)#no switchport trunk allowed vlan 3
SW1(config-if)#switchport mode access

SW1(config)#interface fa0/1
SW1(config-if)#no switchport access vlan 2
SW1(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 2
SW1(config-if)#switchport trunk allowed vlan 3

SW1(config)#interface fa0/1
SW1(config-if)#no switchport access vlan 2
SW1(config-if)#switchport access vlan 3
SW1(config-if)#switchport trunk allowed vlan 2

SW1(config)#interface fa0/2
SW1(config-if)#no switchport access vlan 2
SW1(config-if)#no switchport trunk allowed vlan 3
SW1(config-if)#switchport trunk allowed vlan 2

question:
A Cisco engineer is configuring a factory-default router with these three passwords:
* The user EXEC password for console access is p4ssw0rd1
* The user EXEC password for Telnet access is s3cr3t2
* The password for privileged EXEC mode is priv4t3p4ss.
Which command sequence must the engineer configured

choices:
enable secret priv4t3p4ss
line con 0
password login p4ssw0rd1
!
line vty 0 15
password login s3cr3t2
login

enable secret privilege 15 priv4t3p4ss
!
line con 0
password p4ssword1
login
!
line vty 0 15
password s3cr3t2
login

enable secret priv4t3p4ss
!
line con 0
password p4ssw0rd1
login
!
line vty 0 15
password s3cr3t2
login

enable secret priv4t3p4ss
!
line con 0
password p4ssw0rd1
!
line vty 0 15
password s3cr3t2

What is a zero-day exploit?

choices: It is when the perpetrator inserts itself in a conversation between two parties and captures or alters data.
It is when an attacker inserts malicious code into a SQL server.
It is when a new network vulnerability is discovered before a fix is available.
It is when the network is saturated with malicious traffic that overloads resources and bandwidth.

question: What is the role of disaggregation in controller-based networking?

choices: It streamlines traffic handling by assigning individual devices to perform either Layer2 or Layer3 functions.
It enables a network topology to quickly adjust from a ring network to a star network
It divides the control-plane and data-plane functions
It summarizes the routes between the core and distribution layers of the network topology.
